verses.name: Acts 19:28
verses.text: And when they heard these sayings, they were full of wrath, and cried out, saying, Great is Diana of the Ephesians.

verses.name: Acts 19:29
verses.text: And the whole city was filled with confusion: and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia, Paul’s companions in travel, they rushed with one accord into the theatre.

verses.name: Acts 19:30
verses.text: And when Paul would have entered in unto the people, the disciples suffered him not.

verses.name: Acts 19:31
verses.text: And certain of the chief of Asia, which were his friends, sent unto him, desiring him that he would not adventure himself into the theatre.
